thread.title: Cleveland-area weather set for another warming trend this week
thread.title_full: Cleveland-area weather set for another warming trend this week | cleveland.com

author: Cliff Pinckard, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Cleveland-area weather set for another warming trend this week
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio — As fall approaches , the weather in Northeast Ohio will be nearly perfect this week.
Sunshine is in the forecast through the weekend, and temperatures will slowly climb during the week, eventually nearing 80s degrees.
It starts today with a chilly morning as temperatures hover in the low 50s. It will be sunny, however, and warm to about 70.
By Thursday highs will be around 78 degrees, and remain in the mid-70s into the weekend.
The lake forecast is calling for some rather stiff east winds, reaching 15 to 20 knots and kicking up waves of 2 to 4 feet. The water temperature is 71 degrees.
Here's the seven-day forecast from the National Weather Service:
Monday : Sunny with a high near 70. Light east wind becoming north 8 to 13 mph in the morning. Mostly clear overnight with a low around 53. Northeast wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm.
Tuesday : Sunny with a high near 72. Light and variable wind becoming north 5 to 9 mph in the afternoon. Mostly clear Tuesday night with a low around 54. Northeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm in the evening.
Wednesday : Sunny with a high near 76. Calm wind becoming north 5 to 9 mph in the afternoon. Mostly clear Wednesday night with a low around 57.
Thursday : Sunny with a high near 78. Mostly clear overnight with a low around 58.
Friday : Sunny with a high near 76. Mostly clear Friday night with a low around 58.
Saturday : Sunny with a high near 75. Partly cloudy overnight with a low around 57.
Sunday : Mostly sunny with a high near 76.
